snippet: Does Alan Arbesfeld’s 66 word puzzle achieve the right balance?
abstract: Does Alan Arbesfeld’s 66 word puzzle achieve the right balance?
lead_paragraph: FRIDAY’S PUZZLE — I’ve said it before, and I’ll say it again: It’s all about balance. As a constructor, where should your focus lie? Do you focus primarily on good fill? Do you open up the grid so you have lots of long entries, possibly sacrificing some of the short ones along the way? How about the cluing? Or is it possible to pull as many of these and more constraints off and still come up with an enjoyable puzzle?
